name: Stemilt Growers
notes: Largest fresh market sweet cherry shipper in the world. Family-owned since 1964. Signature varieties include Pi単ata, Honeycrisp, Gala, Pink Lady.

name: McDougall & Sons
notes: Founded 1976. 2,200 acres of orchards. Packs 260,000 bins of apples/pears and 11,000-12,000 tons of cherries. Exclusive rights to Ambrosia apple variety. Conventional and organic.

name: Borton Fruit
notes: Premium grower, packer, shipper. Located at 2550 Borton Road, Yakima, WA 98903. Phone: 509-966-3905

name: Allan Brothers
notes: Founded early 1900s. Over 100 years of operation. Cold/controlled atmosphere storage. 31 Allan Road, Naches, WA 98937. Phone: 509-653-2625

name: Domex Superfresh Growers
notes: Sixth generation family-owned. Exclusive grower of Autumn Glory速 apple. 151 Low Rd, Yakima, WA

name: Rainier Fruit Company
notes: Offers Envy, Jazz, and Pacific Rose varieties. 510 N. 7th, Brewster, WA 98812

name: Washington Fruit Growers
notes: Operating since 1916. Family-owned. Year-round supply of conventional and organic apples. State-of-the-art technologies.

name: Gebbers Farms
notes: Over a century of experience. One of the most trusted apple growers in the northwestern U.S.

name: Starr Ranch Growers
notes: Founded 1934. Leading fruit grower, packer, and shipper of Northwest-grown fruit.

name: CMI Orchards
notes: One of Washington's largest grower, packer, shipper. CMI Orchards and Daisy Girl Organics are #1 selling brands in the U.S.

name: Matson Fruit
notes: Over 100 years of experience. Renowned grower and distributor.

name: Chelan Fresh Marketing
notes: AltaFresh L.L.C. d/b/a Chelan Fresh Marketing. Top marketer providing 250,000+ boxes of fruit per week year-round.

name: Apple King
notes: Family owned since 1914. Conventional and organic fruit packer. Growing, packing, and shipping company.

name: Fowler Packing Company
notes: Established 1950. Parent company to Peelz Citrus, Samsons Grapes, G3 Development. 8570 S Cedar Ave, Fresno, CA

name: Bari Produce
notes: Founded ~1915. Stone fruit packed in premium BARI速 label. Extra large apricots from Panoche Hills micro-climate.

name: Trinity Fruit Company
notes: Family-owned grower, packer, shipper. 7571 N. Remington Ave, Suite 104, Fresno, CA 93711. Organic produce available.

name: Sunnyside Packing Company
notes: Third generation family owned and operated grower, packer, shipper of fresh fruits and vegetables.

name: Family Tree Farms
notes: Ranches in California, Mexico, and Peru. Focus on flavor, quality, integrity, and safety.

name: Giumarra Vineyards
notes: Family-owned for 80+ years. Premium California table grapes. P.O. Box 861449 Los Angeles, CA 90086. Phone: 213-627-2900

name: Pandol Bros Inc
notes: Leading producer for 70+ years. Grower-shipper and marketer. Imports/exports worldwide.

name: Delano Farms
notes: In production since 1991. Thousands of acres in San Joaquin, Coachella, and Mexico. Trademarked Pristine速 green seedless.

name: Four Star Fruit
notes: Since 1987. Campbell family owned for three generations. Fields in San Joaquin, Coachella, and Mexico. Organic and conventional.

name: Castle Rock Vineyards
notes: Vineyards in Coachella, Arvin, Bakersfield, Delano, Ducor, Lindsay, and Reedley. Sales staff at Delano cold storage.

name: Jasmine Vineyards
notes: Founded 1947 by Martin and Vincent Zaninovich. One of the largest table grape growers in the United States.

name: Anthony Vineyards Inc
notes: CFFA member. Shipper/Marketer member.

name: Lane Southern Orchards
notes: 100+ years in business. Started 1908. State-of-the-art facility completed 1990. Capacity: 1 million 25-lb cartons/season. Merged with Taylor Orchards 2018 to create largest peach/pecan operation in U.S.

name: Pearson Farm
notes: 100+ years growing on same land. 1,500 acres peaches, 2,000 acres pecans. Packing facility converted from old Zenith Consolidated School in 1975.

name: Dickey Farms
notes: One of four commercial peach farms in Georgia with Genuine Georgia Group relationship.

name: Fitzgerald Fruit Farms
notes: One of four commercial peach farms in Georgia with Genuine Georgia Group relationship.

name: IMG Citrus
notes: Citrus grower, importer, packer. New flagship facility 'Sweet Sixty' - integrated cold storage, packing, distribution hub.

name: Dundee Citrus Growers Association
notes: Established 1924. One of largest fresh fruit cooperatives in Florida. 10,000+ acres. Multiple citrus varieties.

name: Florida Classic Growers
notes: Co-operative owned by Dundee Citrus Growers Association. Fresh Florida citrus since 1924.

name: Hollieanna Groves
notes: Family owned and operated since 1954. Store and packing house in Maitland.

name: Countryside Citrus
notes: Family business for five generations. Leading grower, harvester, shipper of pristine Florida oranges and grapefruit.

name: Hyatt Fruit Company
notes: Shipping since 1946. 75+ years in business. Family owned and operated. Fresh fruit gift baskets and citrus candy.

name: Al's Family Farms
notes: Indian River grapefruit, Honeybells, Navel oranges, Temple oranges, Valencia oranges, tangerines fresh-picked.

name: Lone Star Citrus Growers
notes: Last independent family-owned Texas citrus packing house. Flowers family. 9625 N. Moorefield Rd., Mission, TX 78574. Phone: 956-424-3334. Ships Oct-Mar/Apr.

name: Rio Grande Juice Company
notes: Largest citrus juice manufacturer in Texas. Division of Wonderful Citrus since 2015. Processing plant in Mission.

name: Hudson River Fruit Distributors
notes: One of largest East Coast apple shippers. State-of-the-art equipment. Represents 10,000+ acres in NY State and New England.

name: George W. Saulpaugh & Son
notes: Wholesale apple grower, packer, shipper. ~20 varieties. 8 Controlled Atmosphere Storage Rooms for 150,000 bushels. GlobalGap and SCS GMP Certified.

name: Dressel Farms
notes: 300+ acres of apple trees, 20+ varieties. Annually packs and ships 100,000+ bushels (4M lbs) to east coast and overseas.

name: Apple Acres
notes: Family owned. Varieties include Rubyfrost, SnapDragon, Macintosh, Empire. Packs for other NY apple growers.

name: Fowler Farms
association: New York Apple Association, Crunch Time Apple Growers
notes: Sixth generation. Largest grower of Honeycrisp and SweeTango in NY State. 30+ varieties, 30 acres certified organic.

name: Applewood Fresh Growers LLC
notes: Aligns with: Applewood Orchards (Deerfield), Elite Apple Co. (Sparta), Michigan Apple Packers Cooperative (Sparta), Umlor Orchards (Conklin).

name: Ridgeking Apple Packing / Heeren Brothers
notes: Stores and packs apples for 75+ family-owned Michigan growers. Packs 20%+ of all fresh apples grown in Michigan. Joint venture with Applewood Orchards = All Fresh GPS.

name: Underwood Fruit and Warehouse Co
notes: Established early 1900s. Major packer in Hood River, The Dalles, White Salmon districts. Hood River/White Salmon pears renowned for appearance, flavor, storage.

name: Stadelman Fruit LLC
notes: Pear facility at 3366 Stadelman Dr, Hood River, OR 97031. Phone: 541-354-1224

name: Oregon Growers & Shippers LLC
notes: Farm Direct Foods from Pacific Northwest. 508 Oak Ave, Hood River, OR 97031.

name: Pearl's Place Fruit / Viewmont Orchards
notes: Established 1901 by Walter Wells. 500+ acres. Pack and ship under Viewmont Orchards label.

name: Diamond Fruit Growers
association: Columbia Gorge Fruit Growers, Northwest Horticultural Council
notes: Full member of NHC. Export Trade Certificate of Review holder.

name: Rice Fruit Company
notes: Largest apple-packing facility in Eastern half of U.S. Founded 1913 by Arthur Rice. Receives/stores/packs 1M+ boxes annually for 40+ farm families.

name: Bear Mountain Orchards
notes: Family owned and operated for 75+ years. Grower, packer, shipper. Specialize in fresh, local, safe produce. Potato Road near Aspers.

name: Associated Citrus Packers Inc
notes: 48 years in business. 2 W 6th St, Yuma, AZ 85364. Wholesale fruits and vegetables, frozen foods.

name: Limoneira Company
notes: Citrus shipper in Yuma County.

name: Mission Citrus
notes: Citrus shipper in Yuma County.
